enWisdom: When the intellects decrease, impertinent speech increases

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا يَعْقِلُ يَهُنْ وَمَنْ يَهُنْ لَا يُوَقَّرْ
enWisdom: One who does not use intellect is abased, and one who is abased is not revered

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا عَقْلَ لَهُ لَا تَرْتَجِيهِ
enWisdom: Do not have any expectations from one who has no intellect

Wisdom: مَنْ ضَيَّعَ عَاقِلًا دَلَّ عَلَى ضَعْفِ عَقْلِهِ
enWisdom: One who loses [the friendship of] an intelligent one shows the weakness of his [own] intellect
One whose intellect is less, his jesting is increased

Wisdom: مَنْ قَعَدَ بِهِ الْعَقْلُ قَامَ بِهِ الْجَهْلُ
enWisdom: One who is held back by intellect is driven forward by ignorance

Wisdom: مَنْ فَاتَهُ الْعَقْلُ لَمْ يَعْدُهُ الذُّلُّ
enWisdom: One who loses his wits is not bypassed by abasement

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ عَقْلٌ يَزِينُهُ لَمْ يَنْبُلْ
enWisdom: One who does not have an intellect to adorn him, does not become noble

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَكْمُلْ عَقْلُهُ لَمْ تُؤْمَنْ بَوَائِقُهُ
enWisdom: One whose intellect is not complete, his evils are not safeguarded against
Intellect [and wisdom] and idle play do not go together

Wisdom: لَا مَرَضَ أَضْنَى مِنْ قِلَّةِ الْعَقْلِ
enWisdom: There is no ailment more debilitating than lack of intellect

Wisdom: لَا دِينَ لِمَنْ لَا عَقْلَ لَهُ
enWisdom: He who has no intellect has no religion

Wisdom: لَا يُوثَقُ بِعَهْدِ مَنْ لَا عَقْلَ لَهُ
enWisdom: The promise of one who has no intellect is not relied upon

Wisdom: ضَلَالُ الْعَقْلِ يُبْعِدُ مِنَ الرَّشَادِ وَيُفْسِدُ الْمَعَادَ
enWisdom: Straying of the intellect distances one from right guidance and corrupts his Hereafter

Wisdom: ِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ إِزَالَةَ نِعْمَةٍ عَنْ عَبْدٍ كَانَ‏ أَوَّلُ مَا يُغَيِّرُ عَنْهُ عَقْلَهُ وَأَشَدُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ عَلَيْهِ فَقْدَهُ
enWisdom: When Allah, the Glorified, wishes to remove a blessing from a servant, the first thing that He alters [and takes away from him] is his intellect, and losing it is the most difficult thing for him

Wisdom: يُعْجِبُنِي مِنَ الرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَرَى عَقْلَهُ زَائِداً عَلَى لِسَانِهِ وَلَا يَرَى لِسَانَهُ زَائِداً عَلَى عَقْلِهِ
enWisdom: I am amused by a man whose intellect is seen as an extension of his tongue, while his tongue is not seen as an extension of his intellect
